cellularAutomata.lattice
Class GlobalSquareLattice

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      java.util.AbstractList<E>
          java.util.ArrayList<Cell>
              cellularAutomata.lattice.TwoDimensionalLattice
                  cellularAutomata.lattice.SquareLattice
                      cellularAutomata.lattice.GlobalSquareLattice
All Implemented Interfaces:
Lattice, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<Cell>, java.util.Collection<Cell>, java.util.List<Cell>, java.util.RandomAccess
public class GlobalSquareLattice
extends SquareLattice

A simple two-dimensional square lattice with every cell being a neighbor to every other cell. The wrap around/reflection boundary conditions and choice of neighbors are implemented in the getNeighbors() method.

Author:
David Bahr
See Also:

Field Detail

DISPLAY_NAME

public static final java.lang.String DISPLAY_NAME
The display name for this lattice.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

MAX_NUM_CELLS_TO_PRELOAD_NEIGHBORS

public static final int MAX_NUM_CELLS_TO_PRELOAD_NEIGHBORS
The maximum size of the lattice (width * height) which will preload the neighbors (for each cell) in a hashmap. If larger than this, neighbors will be calculated on the fly (slower but less memory intensive).

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

GlobalSquareLattice

public GlobalSquareLattice()
Default constructor required of all Lattices (for reflection). Typically not used to build the lattice, but instead used to gain access to methods such as getDisplayName() and getNumberOfNeighbors().

GlobalSquareLattice

public GlobalSquareLattice(java.lang.String initialStateFilePath,
                           Rule rule,
                           int maxHistory)
Create a two-dimensional cellular automaton with the same rule at all positions. The height and width of the automaton and the initial state of each cell is specified in a file.

Parameters:
rule - The rule applied to all cells.
initialStateFilePath - The path to the file that specifies the initial state of the cellular automaton. If null, uses default initial state.
maxHistory - The maximum number of generations (or time steps) that will be remembered by the cells on the lattice.
Method Detail

getDisplayName

public java.lang.String getDisplayName()
A brief one or two-word string describing the rule, appropriate for display in a drop-down list.

Specified by:
getDisplayName in interface Lattice
Overrides:
getDisplayName in class SquareLattice
Returns:
A string no longer than 25 characters.

getNeighbors

public Cell[] getNeighbors(Cell cell)
Overrides the parent class method and returns an array of all cells that are connected to the specified cell, excluding itself. This method is slower than the normal approach which uses getNeighboringCells() to pre-build an array for fast access. But this approach saves lots of memory.

Specified by:
getNeighbors in interface Lattice
Overrides:
getNeighbors in class TwoDimensionalLattice
Parameters:
cell - The specified cell.
Returns:
The neighbors of the specified cell.

getNumberOfNeighbors

public int getNumberOfNeighbors()
Returns the number of neighbors of a cell on the lattice (excluding the cell). If the cells have a varying number of neighbors, then this returns -1, and the user should use getNeighbors(Cell cell) to find the number of neighbors for any particular cell.

Specified by:
getNumberOfNeighbors in interface Lattice
Overrides:
getNumberOfNeighbors in class SquareLattice
Returns:
The number of neighbors for each cell, or -1 if that number is variable.

setView

public void setView(LatticeView view)
Sets the graphics that tells the Lattice how to display itself. Unless a non-default is desired, the view does not have to be set by the user (because a default is always used).

Specified by:
